uml2rca.adaptation

Class AbstractRelationshipWithAbstractMembersAdaptation<E extends org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Relationship>

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.transformation.AbstractTransformation<S,T>
      • core.adaptation.AbstractAdaptation<E,java.util.List<E>>
        • uml2rca.adaptation.AbstractRelationshipWithAbstractMembersAdaptation<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAdaptation<E,java.util.List<E>>, ITransformation<E,java.util.List<E>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssociationWithAbstractMembersAdaptation, DependencyWithAbstractMembersAdaptation

    public abstract class AbstractRelationshipWithAbstractMembersAdaptation<E extends org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Relationship>
extends AbstractAdaptation<E,java.util.List<E>>
    an AbstractRelationshipWithAbstractMembersAdaptation abstract generic class that is used to factor the common interface and state of all concrete relationships with abstract class members (e.g. associations, association classes, dependencies, etc.)

    The adaptation consists of creating a list of target relationships having the same owning package as the source relationship to adapt, such that the members of each target relationship consist of the original non abstract members of the source relationship and a non abstract child of the original abstract member of the source relationship.
    Author:
    Bachar Rima
    See Also:
    AbstractAdaptation, Relationship

      protected java.util.Queue<E> newRelationshipsQueue
      The queue used to contain the generated intermediary relationships, having abstract members, starting from the source relationship to adapt, and that'll end up containing the target relationships with no abstract members to be dequeued and returned by this adaptation
      protected java.util.List<E> relationshipsToClean
      The list of intermediary relationships to clean, having abstract members, which are generated from the source relationship to adapt while creating the target relationships having no abstract members

    • Method Detail

      • preTransform

        public void preTransform(E source)
        Sets the provided entity as the source of this adaptation and initializes the map of abstract members as an empty hash table, the queue of intermediary relationships as an empty linked list, and the list of intermediary relationships to clean as an empty array list.
        Specified by:
        preTransform in interface ITransformation<E extends org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Relationship,java.util.List<E extends org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Relationship>>
        Overrides:
        preTransform in class AbstractTransformation<E extends org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Relationship,java.util.List<E extends org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Relationship>>
        Parameters:
        source - the source model element to transform.

      • transform

        public java.util.List<E> transform(E source)
        Initializes the list of target relationships to be returned by this method using the createNewRelationshipEmptyList() method of this class, and the content of the abstract members dictionary using the initSourceRelationshipAbstractMembersDictionary() method of this class, then adds the source relationship with abstract members to the queue of intermediary relationships with abstract members.
        While the queue is not empty, it peeks at its head relationship R, and checks if R has any abstract member. If R does have an abstract member M, then for each non abstract subclass S of M, it generates an intermediary relationship I that's identical to R, but that replaces M with S, using the cloneAndAdaptIntermediaryRelationship(Relationship, Class, Class) method of this class, and enqueues I into the queue. It then adds R to the list of intermediary relationships to clean. If, on the other hand, R doesn't have any abstract member, then R is one of the target relationships to be returned by this adaptation, and that'll be added to the list of relationships returned by this method. Finally, the method dequeues R.
        Moreover, once the queue is empty, each target relationship will be named appropriately and owned by the same owning package of the source relationship with abstract members to adapt, using the initTargetRelationshipsNamesAndOwnership(List) method of this class.
        Parameters:
        source - the source model element to transform.
        Returns:
        the target model element.

      • cloneAndAdaptIntermediaryRelationship

        protected E cloneAndAdaptIntermediaryRelationship(E intermediaryRelationship,
                                                  org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class abstractMember,
                                                  org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class subClass)
        Clones the provided enqueued intermediary relationship, using the cloneIntermediaryRelationship(Relationship) method of this class, and adapts its first abstract member by replacing it with one of its non abstract subclasses, using the adaptIntermediaryRelationship(Relationship, Class, Class).
        Parameters:
        intermediaryRelationship - the intermediary relationship to clone and whose first abstract member end will be adapted by this method
        abstractMember - the first abstract member of the provided intermediary relationship whose corresponding member end will be adapted by this method
        subClass - one of the non abstract subclasses of the provided abstract member of the provided intermediary relationship, that will replace the abstract member in the relationship returned by this method
        Returns:
        the cloned relationship obtained from the provided enqueued intermediary relationship and whose first abstract member is adapted by replacing it with the provided non abstract subclass

        Returns:

      • initTargetRelationshipsNamesAndOwnership

        protected abstract void initTargetRelationshipsNamesAndOwnership(java.util.List<E> newOwnedRelationships)
        Sets the name and the owning package for each target relationship in the provided list of target relationships. The owning package is the same one owning the source relationship with abstract members to adapt, whereas the name conforms to the following convention <sourceRelationshipName>-<newNonAbstractMemberName>
        Parameters:
        newOwnedRelationships - the list of target relationships whose names and owning packages are to be set by this method

        Parameters:
        source - the source model element to transform.
